info.title: sevDesk Invoice API
info.description:
# General information Welcome to our Invoice API!
You can use it to manage invoices in your sevDesk account. # Cross-Origin Resource Sharing This API features Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS).
It enables cross-domain communication from the browser.
All responses have a wildcard same-origin which makes them completely public and accessible to everyone, including any code on any site. # Embedding resources When retrieving resources by using this API, you might encounter nested resources in the resources you requested.
For example, an invoice always contains a contact, of which you can see the ID and the object name.
This API gives you the possibility to embed these resources completely into the resources you originally requested.
Taking our invoice example, this would mean, that you would not only see the ID and object name of a contact, but rather the complete contact resource. To embed resources, all you need to do is to add the query parameter 'embed' to your GET request.
As values, you can provide the name of the nested resource.
Multiple nested resources are also possible by providing multiple names, separated by a comma.

servers.description: Our main application instance which most of our customers work with
Our swiss application instance, hosted and maintained by smart seven AG

parameters.name: invoiceType
parameters.description: Specifies the invoice type for which you want to get the next invoice number.

parameters.name: useNextNumber
parameters.description: Specifies if the number sequence should be increased by one.

post.description:
This endpoint offers you the following functionality.
  • Create invoices together with positions and discounts
  • Delete positions while adding new ones
  • Delete or add discounts, or both at the same time
  • Automatically fill the address of the supplied contact into the invoice address
To make your own request sample slimmer, you can omit all parameters which are not required and nullable. However, for a valid and logical bookkeeping document, you will also need some of them to ensure that all the necessary data is in the invoice.

requestBody.description:
Creation data. Please be aware, that you need to provide at least all required parameter
    of the invoice model!

invoice.description: The invoice you want to create

invoicePosSave.description: The invoice positions you want to create. If you don't have any, set to null.

invoicePosDelete.description: The invoice positions you want to delete. If you don't have any, set to null.

discountSave.description: The discounts you want to create. If you don't have any, set to null.

discountDelete.description: The discounts you want to delete. If you don't have any, set to null.

takeDefaultAddress.description: Defines if the address of the supplied contact is automatically filled into the invoice.

get.description: There are a multitude of parameter which can be used to filter. A few of them are attached but for a complete list please check out this list

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the invoices

parameters.name: invoiceNumber
parameters.description: Retrieve all invoices with this invoice number

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Retrieve all invoices with a date equal or higher

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Retrieve all invoices with a date equal or lower

parameters.name: contact[id]
parameters.description: Retrieve all invoices with this contact. Must be provided with contact[objectName]

parameters.name: contact[objectName]
parameters.description: Only required if contact[id] was provided. 'Contact' should be used as value.

parameters.name: customerInternalNote
parameters.description: Retrieve an invoice with the given customer internal note.

post.description:
You can still create invoices by using this request, however, this endpoint does not allow the simultaneous creation of invoice positions. It only creates the invoice object!
Please use the 'saveInvoice' endpoint for creating invoices together with positions, discounts, etc., in one request.
Support for users integrating with this endpoint may be limited.

requestBody.description:
Creation data. Please be aware, that you need to provide at least all required parameter
     of the invoice model!

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice to return

400.description: Bad request. Invoice was not found

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice to return

400.description: Bad request. Invoice was not found

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice to update

200.description: Successful operation - Returns changed invoice resource

get.summary: Check if an invoice is already partially paid
get.description:
Returns 'true' if the given invoice is partially paid - 'false' if it is not.
    Invoices which are completely paid are regarded as not partially paid.

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice to return

put.description: Marks an invoice as sent. This endpoint should not be used any more as it bypasses the normal sending flow.

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice to mark as sent

post.summary: Cancel an invoice / Create cancellation invoice
post.description:
This endpoint will cancel the specified invoice therefor creating a cancellation invoice.
The cancellation invoice will be automatically paid and the source invoices status will change to 'cancelled'.

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice to be cancelled

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: Id of invoice resource to delete

409.description: Conflict - f.e occurs if the invoice is not a draft

post.summary: Render the pdf document of an invoice
post.description:
Using this endpoint you can render the pdf document of an invoice.
Use cases for this are the retrieval of the pdf location or the forceful re-render of a already sent invoice.
Please be aware that changing an invoice after it has been sent to a customer is not an allowed bookkeeping process.

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: Id of invoice to render

requestBody.description: Define if the document should be forcefully re-rendered.

forceReload.description: Define if a forceful re-render should occur.

pdfUrl.description: The url location of the (temporary) document.

pages.description: The amount of pages of the document.

post.description:
This endpoint sends the specified invoice to a customer via email.
This will automatically mark the invoice as sent.
Please note, that in production an invoice is not allowed to be changed after this happened!

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice to be sent via email

text.description: The text of the email. Can contain html.

copy.description: Should a copy of this email be sent to you?

additionalAttachments.description:
Additional attachments to the mail. String of IDs of existing documents in your
     *                      sevdesk account separated by ','

ccEmail.description: String of mail addresses to be put as cc separated by ','

bccEmail.description: String of mail addresses to be put as bcc separated by ','

put.summary: Changed status of invoice if not enshrined

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice from which you want the pdf

value.description: Please have a look in our API-Overview to see what the different status codes mean

get.summary: Retrieve pdf document of an invoice
get.description: Retrieves the pdf document of an invoice with additional metadata.

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice from which you want the pdf

400.description: Bad request. Invoice was not found

put.description: Marks an invoice as sent by a chosen send type.

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice to mark as sent

sendType.description:
Specifies the way in which the invoice was sent to the customer.
Accepts 'VPR' (print), 'VP' (postal), 'VM' (mail) and 'VPDF' (downloaded pfd).

sendDraft.description: Specify if the should be enshrined after marking it as sent.

200.description: Successful operation - Returns changed invoice log entry

objects.description: The invoice object which was marked as sent.

put.description:
This endpoint can be used to book invoices.
Invoices are booked on payment accounts where (bank) transactions are located and might be linked to the transactions by using this endpoint.
For more detailed information about booking invoices, please refer to this section of our API-Overview.

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice to book

amount.description: Amount which should be booked. Can also be a partial amount.

date.description: The booking date. Most likely the current date.

type.description:
Define a type for the booking.
The following type abbreviations are available (abbreviation <-> meaning).
  • N <-> Normal booking / partial booking
  • CB <-> Reduced amount due to discount (skonto)
  • CF <-> Reduced/Higher amount due to currency fluctuations
  • O <-> Reduced/Higher amount due to other reasons
  • OF <-> Higher amount due to reminder charges
  • MTC <-> Reduced amount due to the monetary traffic costs

checkAccount.description: The check account on which should be booked.

id.description: The id of the check account on which should be booked.

checkAccountTransaction.description:
The check account transaction on which should be booked.
The transaction will be linked to the invoice.

id.description: The id of the check account transaction on which should be booked.

createFeed.description: Determines if a feed is created for the booking process.

200.description: Successful operation - Returns changed invoice log entry

objects.description: TODO: Document InvoiceLog and enter scheme here

put.description:
This endpoint can be used to book invoices.
Invoices are booked on payment accounts where (bank) transactions are located and might be linked to the transactions by using this endpoint.
For more detailed information about booking invoices, please refer to this section of our API-Overview.
Be aware, that this endpoint is deprecated and the new endpoint 'bookAmount' should be used instead.

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of invoice to book

ammount.description: Amount which should be booked. Can also be a partial amount.

date.description: The booking date. Most likely the current date.

type.description:
Define a type for the booking.
The following type abbreviations are available (abbreviation <-> meaning).
  • N <-> Normal booking / partial booking
  • CB <-> Reduced amount due to discount (skonto)
  • CF <-> Reduced/Higher amount due to currency fluctuations
  • O <-> Reduced/Higher amount due to other reasons
  • OF <-> Higher amount due to reminder charges
  • MTC <-> Reduced amount due to the monetary traffic costs

checkAccount.description: The check account on which should be booked.

id.description: The id of the check account on which should be booked.

checkAccountTransaction.description:
The check account transaction on which should be booked.
The transaction will be linked to the invoice.

id.description: The id of the check account transaction on which should be booked.

createFeed.description: Determines if a feed is created for the booking process.

200.description: Successful operation - Returns changed invoice log entry

get.description: Get all positions corresponding to an invoice

parameters.name: invoice[objectName]
parameters.description: SevDesk Object name, should be 'Invoice'

parameters.name: invoice[id]
parameters.description: Invoice-ID

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to query

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Get some additional information. Embed can handle multiple values, they must be separated by comma. Default ``.

post.description:
You can still create invoices positions by using this request, however, this endpoint does not allow the simultaneous creation of an invoice. It only creates the invoice position object!
Please use the 'saveInvoice' endpoint for creating invoices together with positions, discounts, etc., in one request.
Support for users integrating with this endpoint may be limited.

requestBody.description:
Creation data. Please be aware, that you need to provide at least all required parameter
    of the invoice position model!

discount.description: Defines if this is a discount or a surcharge

percentage.description: Defines if this is a percentage or an absolute discount

contact.description: The contact used in the invoice

sevClient.description: Client to which invoice belongs. Will be filled automatically

invoiceDate.description: Needs to be provided as timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

header.description: Normally consist of prefix plus the invoice number

headText.description: Certain html tags can be used here to format your text

footText.description: Certain html tags can be used here to format your text

timeToPay.description: The time the customer has to pay the invoice in days

discountTime.description:
If a value other than zero is used for the discount attribute,
    you need to specify the amount of days for which the discount is granted.

discount.description: If you want to give a discount, define the percentage here. Otherwise provide zero as value

addressName.description: Can be omitted as complete address is defined in address attribute

addressStreet.description: Can be omitted as complete address is defined in address attribute

addressZip.description: Can be omitted as complete address is defined in address attribute

addressCity.description: Can be omitted as complete address is defined in address attribute

addressCountry.description: Can be omitted as complete address is defined in address attribute

payDate.description: Needs to be timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

createUser.description: Will be filled automatically by our system and can't be changed

deliveryDate.description: Timestamp. This can also be a date range if you also use the attribute deliveryDateUntil

status.description: Please have a look in our API-Overview to see what the different status codes mean

smallSettlement.description:
Defines if the client uses the small settlement scheme.
    If yes, the invoice must not contain any vat

contactPerson.description: The user who acts as a contact person for the invoice

taxRate.description: Is overwritten by invoice position tax rates

taxText.description: A common tax text would be 'Umsatzsteuer 19%'

dunningLevel.description:
Defines how many reminders have already been sent for the invoice.
    Starts with 1 (Payment reminder) and should be incremented by one every time another reminder is sent.

taxType.description:
Tax type of the invoice.
There are four tax types:
1. default - Umsatzsteuer ausweisen
2. eu - Steuerfreie innergemeinschaftliche Lieferung (Europische Union)
3. noteu - Steuerschuldnerschaft des Leistungsempfngers (auerhalb EU, z. B. Schweiz)
4. custom - Using custom tax set
Tax rates are heavily connected to the tax type used.

paymentMethod.description: Payment method used for the invoice

id.description: Unique identifier of the payment method
Unique identifier of the cost centre

sendDate.description: The date the invoice was sent to the customer

origin.description: Origin of the invoice. Could f.e. be an order

invoiceType.description: Type of the invoice. For more information on the different types, check this section of our API-Overview

accountIntervall.description:
The interval in which recurring invoices are due as ISO-8601 duration.
Necessary attribute for all recurring invoices.

accountLastInvoice.description: Timestamp when the last invoice was generated by this recurring invoice.

accountNextInvoice.description: Timestamp when the next invoice will be generated by this recurring invoice.

reminderDeadline.description: Deadline of the reminder as timestamp

taxSet.description: Tax set of the invoice. Needs to be added if you chose the tax type custom

address.description:
Complete address of the recipient including name, street, city, zip and country.
     * Line breaks can be used and will be displayed on the invoice pdf.

currency.description: Currency used in the invoice. Needs to be currency code according to ISO-4217

sumDiscounts.description: Sum of all discounts in the invoice

sumNetForeignCurrency.description: Net sum of the invoice in the foreign currency

sumTaxForeignCurrency.description: Tax sum of the invoice in the foreign currency

sumGrossForeignCurrency.description: Gross sum of the invoice in the foreign currency

sumDiscountsForeignCurrency.description: Discounts sum of the invoice in the foreign currency

sumNetAccounting.description: Net accounting sum of the invoice. Is usually the same as sumNet

sumTaxAccounting.description: Tax accounting sum of the invoice. Is usually the same as sumTax

sumGrossAccounting.description: Gross accounting sum of the invoice. Is usually the same as sumGross

paidAmount.description: Amount which has already been paid for this invoice by the customer

customerInternalNote.description: Internal note of the customer. Contains data entered into field 'Referenz/Bestellnummer'

showNet.description: If true, the net amount of each position will be shown on the invoice. Otherwise gross amount

enshrined.description: Defines if and when invoice was enshrined. Enshrined invoices can not be manipulated.

sendType.description:
Type which was used to send the invoice. IMPORTANT: Please refer to the invoice section of the
     *     API-Overview to understand how this attribute can be used before using it!

deliveryDateUntil.description:
If the delivery date should be a time range, another timestamp can be provided in this attribute
     * to define a range from timestamp used in deliveryDate attribute to the timestamp used here.

object.description: The contact used in the invoice

objectName.description: Model name, which is 'Invoice' or 'Order' or 'CreditNote'

sevClient.description: Client to which mail belongs. Will be filled automatically

cc.description: A list of mail addresses which are in the cc

bcc.description: A list of mail addresses which are in the bcc

update.description: Date of last invoice position update

invoice.description: The invoice to which the position belongs.

part.description: Part from your inventory which is used in the position.

price.description: Price of the article/part. Is either gross or net, depending on the sevDesk account setting.

unity.description: The unit in which the positions part is measured

sevClient.description: Client to which invoice position belongs. Will be filled automatically

positionNumber.description: Position number of your position. Can be used to order multiple positions.

discountedValue.description: An optional discount of the position.

isPercentage.description: Specifiy if the given discount is in percent.

temporary.description: Defines if the position is temporary

sumNetAccounting.description: Net accounting sum of the position

sumTaxAccounting.description: Tax accounting sum of the position

sumGrossAccounting.description: Gross accounting sum of the position

priceTax.description: Tax on the price of the part

externalDocs.description: If you are new, find more detailed information about our API here
